video.title: Build 15 JavaScript Projects - Vanilla JavaScript Course
video.description:
Sharpen your JavaScript skills by building 15 projects using plain JavaScript without frameworks. In this tutorial course, you will be taught step-by-step how to build JavaScript projects.

💻 Code: https://github.com/john-smilga/javascript-basic-projects
🔗 View completed projects: https://www.vanillajavascriptprojects.com/

✏️ Course created by John Smilga. Check out his YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/codingaddict

🔗 John Smilga's website: https://www.johnsmilga.com

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (00:00) Intro
⌨️ (07:01) Color Flipper
⌨️ (30:25) Counter
⌨️ (44:04) Reviews
⌨️ (1:11:29) Navbar
⌨️ (1:26:21) Sidebar
⌨️ (1:39:03) Modal
⌨️ (1:48:26) Questions
⌨️ (2:16:25) Menu
⌨️ (3:16:13) Video
⌨️ (3:32:45) Scroll
⌨️ (4:36:15) Tabs
⌨️ (4:58:53) Countdown
⌨️ (5:56:35) Lorem Ipsum
⌨️ (6:18:23) Grocery
⌨️ (8:01:14) Slider

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

Probably the organization of the code becomes simpler.
Example:
Each project goes in a folder. If you are pursuing a career in programming, if the code is not going to be read only by you and a file made only of html and css and JS ends up becoming gigantic and maintenance becomes very complicated. But get used to it, or try to get used to creating separate files. In the future you will be grateful.
Search for 'Clean Code'.

to elaborate, instead of having class=btn and id=btn we can just have class=btn and another class=btnid and bring in class of  btnid instead of id of btn. so there's no confusion as to whether we have class or id of btn and which one is being used or linked.

replies.author: S Sharma
replies.text:
Don't be confused. Id and class can have same name. They are just names of an element. You can use same class name for more than one html element in a page, but an id is used one per page. If you have id or class, but don"t want or don"t need to use, no problem is going to happen. 
* Page means .html document, i.e. index.html.

topLevelComment.author: Anshul Badhani
topLevelComment.text: can anybody explain me why we did Math.random() * colours.length; at 18:03

replies.author: Anshul Badhani
replies.text: @Arun Hembram Thanks

replies.author: Anshul Badhani
replies.text: @Javier Valeriano Thanks

replies.author: Arun Hembram
replies.text: Math.random() always gives a number between 0 to 1 (Example: 0.1587, 0.47881). Which will never return the other colors situated after 1-4. So we need to multiply it (0.values) with 2/3/4. colours.length = 4. Now multiply it with a random number 0.4xxxx * 4 = 1.6xxxx (floor value will be 2), 0.5xxxxxx * 4 = 2.xxxxxx (floor 3) etc.

replies.author: Javier Valeriano
replies.text: We did "Math.random() * colors.length" because we have to generate a random number that does not exceed the length of the array 'colours'. Also, Math.random() generates a random number between 0 (included) and 1 (excluded). Remember that the array has 0-based indexing, so it would generate as maximum value up to the last element of the array.

it represents EVENT. So, when you click on a button that have event handler function its represents event of you clicking on it.
You can call methods on that argument. Like:
 e.target => where event happend?
e.currentTarget => points to an element that have event listener attached

Hope this helps

topLevelComment.author: Mikhail Ladanov
topLevelComment.text: Math.floor isn't rounding UP.  The floor function is the function that takes as input a real number x (which Math.random provides), and gives as output the greatest integer less than or equal to x. Meaning, 0.9 won't turn into 1, but into 0. Which is what we need, we have zero based array, right?

replies.author: Mikhail Ladanov
replies.text: @Saurus990 you know what, you're right. I listened through that section again. First time I thought I heard him saying it rounds up. But then I was skipping a lot. Thanks!

replies.author: Saurus990
replies.text: Yes. And I'm pretty sure he said that in the video. There is also a Math.round() which is more mathematically accurate. Math.ceil() for rounding up.

replies.author: Ronald Maffei de Lavor
replies.text:
Catecismo de São Pio X

Lição Preliminar

Da Doutrina Cristã suas partes principais
Em seguida Barnabé foi para Tarso, à procura de Saulo. Encontrou-o e o levou para Antioquia. Durante um ano estiveram juntos naquela igreja e instruíram muita gente. Foi em Antioquia que, pela primeira vez, os discípulos foram chamados cristãos.(At 11, 25-26).

1) Sois cristão?
Sim, sou cristão pela graça de Deus.

2) Por que dizeis pela graça de Deus?
Digo: pela graça de Deus, porque o ser cristão é um dom de Deus, inteiramente gratuito, que nós não podemos merecer.

3) E quem é verdadeiro cristão?
Verdadeiro cristão é aquele que é batizado, crê e professa a doutrina cristã e obedece
aos legítimos Pastores da Igreja.

4) Que é a Doutrina Cristã?
A Doutrina Cristã é a doutrina que Jesus Cristo Nosso Senhor nos ensinou, para nos
mostrar o caminho da salvação.

5) É necessário aprender a doutrina ensinada por Jesus Cristo?
Certamente, é necessário aprender a doutrina ensinada por Jesus Cristo, e cometem
falta grave aqueles que se descuidam de o fazer.

6) Os pais e patrões estão obrigados a mandar ao catecismo os seus filhos e dependentes?
Os pais e patrões são obrigados a procurar que seus filhos e dependentes aprendam a
Doutrina Cristã; e são culpados diante de Deus, se desprezarem esta obrigação.

7) De quem devemos nós receber e aprender Doutrina Cristã?
Devemos receber e aprender a Doutrina Cristã da Santa Igreja Católica.

topLevelComment.author: Amélie Gorry
topLevelComment.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to build and walk us through these awesome projects. I was looking for practice on the DOM events with pure JS and I couldn't have dreamt of better use cases and tutorial. I find it so rare to find an experienced programmer who actually takes the time to break down each step of what they're doing and repeat (in no convoluted sentences) the logic and reasoning behind the code! I also picked up on some tips such as installing some extensions on VS code (like the Live Server one) and learning key shortcuts (you def need those when you follow along typing HTML!). Subscribed and will recommend this video (and probably the others I'll watch) to anyone, that's the least we can do! Thanks again for your pedagogy!
